plot: Kate and Toby go to Las Vegas for their bachelor/bachelorette parties; Jack and Rebecca celebrate their anniversary.

Jack and Rebecca are celebrating another anniversary and have decided not to exchange gifts this year, unlike the grand gestures Jack always does, which means something big, and the very personal gift Rebecca always gets Jack. They get around this decision when the kids decide to make that grand gesture on their parents' behalf for their anniversary. But a grand gesture in the mind of a 10-year-old and the execution of such is a totally different beast than that of an adult. In present day, Toby and Kate are having their respective bachelor and bachelorette parties concurrently in Las Vegas. The bride and groom and the other members of the Pearson family have their own expectations and/or baggage going into the event. Although he has invited a handful of so-called friends, Toby, in light of his own family situation, hopes it will be a "Pearson brothers" bonding session, being the latest entry into that club. Beyond the fact that Madison is organizing her get together, Kate is nervous about spending time with Beth, with whom she has not spent a great deal of quality alone time. This get-together will be Kevin's first real test of his sobriety, which is made all the more difficult by some news he receives. And Randall and Beth are on diverging paths, Randall still fixated on Déjà's recent visit and feeling like she may still need them while they are away on this trip and Beth really feeling the need for some decompression from all that is happening in their lives.—Huggo
